inn1.comm: shortish on off stump, Kusal meets it under his eyes and rather deep in the crease
inside edge, perhaps? Persistent appeal for leg-before as Irfan goes full and straight. Kusal decides to play straight which helps him out just enough. Big deflection off the bat and onto the pads
128 kph, hits the deck and pushes the batsman back. The line is a shade outside off stump as well. Kusal is jumping up off his feet to slice into the covers
get on the front foot at your own peril says the bounce Irfan can get. This is a 141 kph stinger just outside off, kisses the even grass covering on the pitch and zips away past the outside edge
keeps back and taps a shortish delivery right through point. He's got his head down, trying to hide himself as best he could. Poor work from Shehzad
solidly blocked in front of middle and leg. Irfan's generating some good pace, 142 kph
some bounce for him too. Shapes the back of a good length ball into Dilshan at 131 kph. He was looking to clip it behind square leg, but it comes off the pitch a little too quickly to connect
slips a bit too far down the leg side at 135 kph. Decent length though, but it was too far off line. Dilshan attempts a big leg glance, no luck
that time he ekes it off his pads. Neat little clip to send a good length ball to deep square leg
137 kph, keeps to the crease and blocks a shortish delivery outside off to cover
good ploy against Kusal. Keeping the ball nice and tight and not letting him free those hands. This one's a shortish delivery on middle and leg, nudged away towards square leg
looks to force the pace, but again there isn't enough room. Plays off the back foot and looks for a punch wide of mid-off. Only manages an inside edge
shortish on middle, blocked carefully
goes fuller this time, but the cut back into Dilshan beats him again. Inches that front leg a little too far across and struggles to play around it. Struck in the pads, but it would be sliding down
clipped off the thigh pad. Irfan throws his head back as he watches the ball skip away a little too fine for the fine leg fielder
129 kph, short and on leg stump again, Dilshan swivels on his back foot and pulls it away to long leg
the cut Irfan gets back helps the batsman out this time. Kusal reads it well, gets inside the line and glances off his thigh pad to long leg.

nicked and gone! Dilshan's stay is a short one in Sri Lanka's first ODI back from the world cup. Or maybe not! Irfan's overstepped! That's dreadful for the bowler. Managed a peach on off stump. The length was short, which sucked Dilshan into playing a cut. Suddenly he realises it is too close to the bat and it was bounce a bit too much. Gloves it to Sarfraz, who takes a good catch coming forward. But it's all for nought
length ball, swung away to mid-on. Easy catch, but this is a free hit. So he can't be out
does better in keeping that front pad from criss-crossing into the line of his bat. Good inswing bowling from Irfan
gets up on his tip toes to slap a short and slightly wide delivery to cover
short of a length and outside off, dabbed into the covers again

but once there's just enough width, that strong bottom hand gets into the act. Lifts it over point and it's got enough behind it to take the fielder all the way to the boundary after it. Yasir Shah treads on the rope as he pulls it back
not as much room that time and he gets the bottom of the inside edge as he tries to cut
fuller on middle and off, driven to mid-off
good work from Sarfraz, leaping to his right to haul down a deflection off the pads. Rahat going a bit too straight and is lucky not to be clipped off

loads of bounce just outside off, as you'd expect from a bowler who's seven feet tall. Kusal is well enough behind it and blocks with soft hands. So the ball trickles down and away to the left of the second slip
banged in that time and Dilshan's managed to pull it around the corner to long leg
another attempted bouncer at 135 kph, Kusal is happy to sink below its line on and around off stump
a careful push in front of point. The natural bounce Irfan gets off back of a length, coupled with his fifth-stump line makes him such a hard bowler to face

how did that go there? It's a 146 kph low full toss that Kusal looks to swing away over square leg. (That shot remind you of anyone?) Only unlike Jayasuriya, his idol, he isn't able to connect well. Gets perhaps a glove and it deflects back to the keeper
comes forward to block a good length ball into the off side
outside edge squirts away to third man. Pitches it up and gets decent bounce. The angle away from the right hander miffs Dilshan, who was driving on the up.
that's well done. Perhaps Sri lanka's best option with this line of attack. Dab and run. This single's been pinched after he gets up tall and hits in front of cover
again, lovely work. Goes back to nudge into the cover region and the fielder rushes in fast enough. Dilshan's just a touch quicker
shortish on middle and leg, Kusal manages an inside edge to find a single to long leg
nicely manoeuvres as shorter delivery down to long leg. Moving just inside the line to help it on its way
ugly crunch off the bottom of the bat as he swipes over mid-on. Not quite the amount of bounce for Rahat and this has been pulled on length.
change in length, and pace of course. This is full on middle and Dilshan likes it. Goes for a big drive but only gets an inside edge to long leg
smeared through extra! Overpitched delivery invites the left-hander onto the front foot and then Kusal's strength takes over. Simply done
corrects his length, and his line as he hits a good length on middle. Manages to get a touch more bounce as Kusal looks to clip to midwicket. Hits the splice and pops up in the air for a short while
only a single slip in place so Dilshan can back away and flay away. A thick outside edge soars over the sparsely packed cordon and fine enough that third man had no chance
good length ball on middle and off, carefully defended

appeal, a strong one again for leg before. Anwar Ali thinks this is immensely close. But he can't convince his captain to go for the review. It was full and had Dilshan falling over a touch as he plays the flick thorugh midwicket. But there might just have been an inside edge
slapped behind point. Gets up off the pitch to get on top of the bounce, and then he takes advantage of the width. Lifts it over point because he trusts his power. Good shot
back of a length and only a shade outside off this time, dabbed to point.

another flay over point! That's why he can be dangerous. There is no one deep there and Kusal knows it. Even if there's the slightest width, he's throwing the bat at it. But while doing that he's making sure he gets enough elevation to beat the infield and keeping it well to the left of deep third man
shortish on middle and leg, defended

to deep square leg this time. Anything short has just got to go, it seems. Swivels on the back foot and pulls along the ground. It's nice to see him taking his talent a little more seriously. Not going hammer and tongs at every ball. Better shot selection so far
full and wide, Dilshan's sucked into a booming drive through the covers. But he doesn't make contact. Senior pro's looked scratchy so far
fullish and just a shade outside of, jabbing punch to the covers
turn and loads of bounce. Grips in pitch, drifts in and turns. Kusal targets the leg side and misses, takes it on the pad

Hafeez gets another left-hand batsman. Kusal left contemplating another start not converted. Pushed through outside off, non-turning ball. Kusal looks to push, or perhaps punch it through the covers. All he manages a thick edge to first slip. Sharp take from Rizwan just below chest height. Kusal did not move his feet and pays the price
hurled full on middle, right in the blockhole at 87.5ks, dug out
on a length and on middle, turned to the leg side
Hafeez gives this ample air around off, Thirimanne replies with a solid defence
pitched up full and wide outside off, Dilshan chasing it with a lashing drive. He wants to kitchen-sink it away but can't connect. Irfan sticks his tongue out
shortish and zipping through outside off - right in the Irfan zone. Ignored
short and sliding away with the angle outside off, Dilshan watches it through to Sarfraz

beaten soundly! Irfan and Sarfraz go up for a caught-behind appeal. Back of a length and cuts away outside off with lifting bounce. Dilshan is lured into a jittery waft and misses. The ball was not far away from kissing the outside edge
short again, this one does not have much bite. Dilshan drags a pull in the gap at midwicket. He comes back for the third
veering onto the pads, nuggety nurdle wide of midwicket as Thirimanne gets off the mark
fuller and on off, blocked to the covers
sliding onto the pads, clipped away through backward square leg
looped up on off, down the track and patted back to the bowler
flighted on a length and turning away outside off, Thirimanne exploits the pace of Hafeez and runs it away to deep third man after camping back
Thirimanne aims to turn it to the leg side but ends up getting a leading edge to off
loopier from Hafeez, dabbed in front of point
yorker at the base of off at 141kph, Dilshan jabs his bat down hurriedly and keeps it out
banged in short, Dilshan brings out the pull and plays it to deep backward square leg
whoa! Loads of bounce outside off. Short of a length and trampolines outside off en route to Sarfraz, who takes it over his head. Dilshan wears a wry smile on his face
follows the short ball with a pinpoint yorker, Dilshan digs it out off an inside edge
length ball on off, Dilshan strides forward for a lashing drive. He does not time it well, jabbed to the man at mid-off
short and sliding away outside off, Dilshan lets it pass
nips down to the pitch of a slow, loopy delivery. And then he is aware of the yawning gap at midwicket. Deftly puts it there and hustles a couple
advances and takes it on the full this time, but remains cautious. Soft drive to long-on
leans forward, that back leg lifting up so he can do so, and he works a tossed up delivery on off stump to long-on
seems the straighter one, or just the one that doesn't turn as much. Pushed in on off stump and defended well
lots of flight from Hafeez, Thirimanne is forward to defend under his eyes
a bit short that time, Thirimanne taps it to point
stays inside the line of a flighted delivery on leg stump and by doing so he drives to cover
that's Yasir's strength. The turn is always very quick. Dilshan went back, thinking it was a short ball and liable to be cut away. But the ball hits the turf and zips away into the keeper's gloves
flighted and angled in on leg stump, turned away to midwicket
Anwar Ali dives a tad too late and parries it away to deep point. Not the best work from. Dilshan manages to make good enough contact on the cut and gets a little more lucky with the fielding
flighted on middle, kept out
waits deep in his crease to a rather fuller delivery and punches it back at the bowler
has to wait a touch on the good length ball just outside off and then pushes it into the covers. Pleasing speeds from Hafeez. In the mid-80 kphs

that's sweet as well! A hint of drift in on off stump, but Hafeez has tossed this a bit too far up. Thirimanne lunges forward with his giant backlift poised to give out punishment and the downswing is excellent. Slog sweep over midwicket
fuller delivery outside off, drills to long-off
credit to Hafeez to keep bowling the ball slower. Good lenght ball outside off, defended
tucked away through midwicket as Hafeez, for once, goes a flat and quick on middle
flighted outside off, calmly pushed to long-off
pushed through on middle and off, defended
spotted the googly there and plays with the turn. Beautiful glide to the third man boundary. But why doesn't Yasir get a slip?
meanders down the pitch and drives to long-on. He's looked quite confident against spin so far. Wonder what happens when he has to play Tests though...
a bit too short is Yasir and Dilshan makes him pay. Hammers it away past short midwicket. Text book 101, when the spinner drags it down, you make him wish he wasn't playing
pushed through on off stump, no turn there at that pace. Defended
flighted just outside off, Dilshan drives to long-off and that appears to be drinks
shortish and just outside off, slid away to point. And oh, we've got a swarm of bees somewhere watching the cricket with great intent
shortish and outside off, picks the gap between point and cover. Sri Lanka have done well in getting those singles often enough

he's been sucked into the drive and the edge is safely taken. Anwar claps in glee and then morphs into an airplane. Hands spread out, mouth wide open in a yell. Good ball, better celebrations. Good length ball skirting outside off, Thirimanne is tempted into a loose shot. Looked so good only for a soft dismissal. Pakistan are ringing in the changes, and they're working
good length ball on middle, defended

edged and falls short! Anwar's looking a lot better in his second spell. Probing the corridor just outside the left-hander, Tharanga pokes but does so with soft hands. Good on Azhar Ali to have a slip. But that time it didn't quite work
shortish and outside off, Tharanga is happy to go onto the back foot and punches it through to deep cover
uses the depth of the crease against a shortish delivery outside off. The extra time allows Dilshan to slice the ball to deep point
teasing flight outside off, Tharanga checks his drive to short cover
pushed down to long-on as Yasir gets a little drift in on middle and leg
looped up on middle and leg, driven to long-off
some turn on off stump after he'd pulled Tharanga onto the front foot. Defends with hard hands and gets an inside edge
goes back and clips to midwicket
a shortish delivery outside off, camping on the back foot as he mistimes a cut to point
angled into the pads and Dilshan's clipped it away to deep midwicket
good length ball just outside off, Tharanga blocks a bit inside the line and as a result gets an outside edge to deep third man
dug in short and Dilshan is a revolving door. Swivels on his back leg and nails a pull to long leg
slower ball, on a good length and just outside off, defended
steps forward to the slower ball and drives to short cover quite nicely
shortish on off stump, that looked like it didn't turn and zooted in straight. Lucky that Dilshan managed to get bat on his cut
flighted just outside off, driven smartly to cover
appreciable loop outside off, Dilshan is waiting on the front foot before he unfurls another puncn to cover
a little short again and Dilshan cuts to deep point
calls for the run straight away, and he's done well. Picked out Rahat at mid-off is a weak link.
good length on middle and leg, Dilshan works it to short midwicket
keeps back to a short of a length delivery and punches to the sweeper
good length on middle and off, Dilshan turns it to midwicket again
banged in short, Dilshan goes for the hook. Not the perfect connection and has to settle for a single to long leg
move around the wicket for a good length ball, but the angle helps Tharanga tuck it wide of long-on
switches back over now, and delivers a short of a length ball on off stump. Defended
that's the slower ball, pushed fuller and outside off. Tharanga gets forward to a drive that finds point
keeps back as Yasir doesn't afford that much flight. Crunched to deep point
tossed up outside off, Tharanga is looking for the big drive through cover. Can't beat the man
moves back to turn a shortish delivery off his pads to deep square leg
another easy little put away to deep point as Dilshan prefers to stay on the back foot when the ball is on a good length
takes a lot of effort to get down from over seven foot. Irfan at short third man tumbles a bit too late and gifts a boundary. Neat little back cut from Tharanga, as he steps away from the line
loops in on middle and leg, nudged away to long leg
fullish on off stump, perhaps off pace as well. Tharanga wisely waits and dabs it to cover
crisply hit, but straight at cover. Fuller line is tagged with enough width for Tharanga to go for his favourite drive through the off side
another slower ball, floated fuller and outside off. Tharanga goes full-blooded at it. Hits it too hard, and meets the ball too early. So he gets it only off the inside half of the bat to mid-off
fuller delivery on middle, defended
fullish on middle and leg, clipped away to deep square leg
that has to have hurt. Rizwan, at short cover, wrings his hand as he dives to save a certain boundary. Another sumptuous hit from Tharanga against a full and wide delivery
starts around the wicket to the left-hander, who goes back and pushes a good length ball to short cover
a bit short that time, Tharanga rocks back to cut. Only gets an under edge
holds in the pitch just a touch as he targets a good length on middle. Beautiful drift and the resulting turn takes the outside edge and it pops into the covers

too good. He is just too good against the left-handers. Angles the good length ball in to force a shot. Tharanga flails at it after lunging outside his crease. The turn is too much, the outside edge is comprehensively beaten. Sarfraz takes care of the rest. Beaten in flight.
nudged down to long-on to get off the mark
good length ball on middle and leg, worked away to deep square
its a decent length just outside off, Dilshan drives into the covers
slower yorker on middle, Dilshan waits for it and taps to the left of short midwicket
banged in on middle, Dilshan pulls to deep square leg. More of a top edge

short and outisde off, Mathews punches it firmly to short cover. It bounced into one of the spare pitches and seemed set to bounce over the infield. But Shehzad leaps up and pulls off a one-handed save
fuller delivery outside off, driven to mid-off
full and tailing in at Dilshan. Manages only an inside edge onto the pads as he goes ofr a drive
goes short and just outside off, allows Dilshan to free his arms and pull to deep square leg

top delivery to the new batsman! Hits the deck and it leaps away over his right shoulder. Mathews was moving across to try and get in line with it, but the wisely drops his wrists and sways his head away
another bouncer from Irfan. But this is a bit too wild. Dug into the middle of the pitch and soaring over Mathews' head. Sarfraz does extremely well to rein that back
fuller delivery just outside leg, Mathews works it away to deep square leg
slashed to point. It's full and wide, Dilshan gets down low with it but finds Shehzad there
back of a length on and around off stump, Mathews blocks it

plays back to one that he should have been forward to. That's a timely strike for Pakistan and it's from their best bowler on show so far. Beautiful control from Hafeez. Doesn't quite loop this one up, which was why Dilshan jumps back in his crease to cut. Suddenly realises the shot is nowhere near on. Tries to protect his off stump. Fails
lobbed up on off stump, Chandimal eases it down the ground to long-on
serene drive to long-on from the captain this time
brings him forward to a flighted delivery on off stump, blocked
just short enough that Chandimal can keep back and cut to deep point
good length ball on off stump, picked away to short midwicket
oof! This is tough stuff. Hits back of a length, slides past the timid poke from Chandimal and thuds into Sarfraz's gloves. Great bowling
back of a length and outside off, Chandimal shoulders arms
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped away to long leg
stays deep in his crease to clip a shortish delivery off his hips to short leg
fuller this time on off stump, Mathews is still back in his crease as he blocks
banged in short and it soars over the crouched Mathews just outside off
flighted just outside off, nudged to long-on
looped up just outside off, Mathews leans forward to block
oh, a little muddled by the lack of turn there. Mathews goes back, hoping for it as he plays a flick. Ends up with a leading edge down the pitch
flatter and quicker on off stump, Mathews jumps back to turn it away to square leg
keeps back to a good length ball and turns it around the corner
nicely tossed up outside off, Mathews presses forward to block
shorter delivery slanted across the right-hander, Chandimal swats it away to deep point
fuller and outside off, Mathews nudges to mid-on
eased down the ground. That was ripe for a punch down the ground, but Mathews checks his shot.
a tad slower, and quite a bit shorter just outside off. Jumps outside off to try and flick it through leg. No such luck. Mathews getting fidgety with all these dot balls. He's 4 off 21
pressure release! But this is more Mathews' doing than the bowler erring. Connects a drive on the up to send a good length ball past mid-off's right

shortish and outside off, Mathews punches it down the pitch and drifts a few feet outside the crease. Rahat stretches out a good left hand and lampoons a throw at the base of the stumps. Third umpire is called in to double-check. All is well for Mathews
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
nips down the track to nudge a flighted delivery on middle to short midwicket
finds the gap this time as he closes the bat face more and gets it to the right of short midwicket

holds in the pitch a tad as Hafeez slows it right down. Doesn't allow the batsman to get under it either. Chandimal is caught in two minds. Plays forward in the end and looks for a flick. Not looking certain at all
slides this down leg, wart about Chandimal stepping down
eased away to short fine leg
good shot! Sized up the flight, planted that front foot across outside off stump to kick lbw out of play and then sweeps powerfully. Gets it well to the left of long leg
shortish and outside off, punched to short cover
fullish on and around off stump, Mathews is cautious as he blocks down the pitch. There's still enough bounce around to force the batsman to remain cautious
taps and runs to mid-off. He was leaning into the drive, as if that had been his intention all along. With hitting throug the line not quite possible, that might be Sri Lanka's best option
good length ball on off stump, defended to point
beautiful slice to deep third man. he hopped up to get on top of the bounce of this short delivery on off stump and lets it run off the open face

down the track and slapped to the long-off boundary. That's a Mathews special. Absorbs all the pressure and then turns it back on the bowler. Picked the length ball early and used his feet to turn it to his advantage
starts around the wicket, so his role seems to be to keep the runs down. Easy single off the flick to deep midwicket
that might have slipped out of his hand. Floated way up and Mathews takes it on the full and clips it to long-on
tossed up on middle and leg, Chandimal tucks it into the leg side
a soft dab behind square and fine leg is just a touch deep. Mathews calls for the single and makes it easy
turned away to mdiwicket
tossed up just outside off, Mathews is on the front foot with a whip to short midwicket
ripper! Lots of oomph behind his action there as he puts enough revs on the ball to bite into the pitch and gain loads of purchase. Turn, bounce, Chandimal's defensive push is no match
flighted outside off, Chandimal leans into a drive to cover
that time a touch short and Chandimal cuts to deep point
flighted on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
good length ball, going on with the arm here. Natural variation for Yasir. Mathews drive calmly to short cover.
flighted on middle and leg, Mathews works it away to deep square leg
just short enough for Mathews to rock back and cut from off stump. Deep point is around though
a little extra bounce for Malik. Tossed up just outside off and it kicks up at Chandimal, who does quite well. Goes back and dabs it behind point
flighted on middle and leg, turned away behind square leg
to the left of long leg this time. Beautifully swept by Chandimal! Good front stride forward, and made sure he had planted it well outside off.

oof, extra bounce. It was on a good length targeting the top of off stump. Chandimal was working the line to his favour by leaping legside of it. Goes for the cut, but he is still cramped and the ball kicks up at him as well. Gets a healthy edge which takes the ball away from Sarfraz's gloves. Can't really call that a drop
slips down the leg side, all Mathews had to do was collect the wide
goes back to slice a good length ball through point
flighted on middle, knocked into the midwicket region for a quick single
flighted on middle and off, gets some encouraging turn and keeps the batsman to a defensive push to point
flighted just outside off, driven back to the bowler
flighted on middle, driven back to Yasir again. Nice, tight, containing lines from the leggie
that's the googly, moving in on middle and leg. Chandimal reads it and clips it midwicket
eesh! A long hop that Chandimal was looking to heave away to the midwicket boundary sticks in the pitch, turns and bounces sharply to beat the batsman and the wicketkeeper. Tough pitch this
flighted on middle and leg, Mathews is down the track to whip it away. Doesn't connect
flicked away fine. Did get a little more bounce, but with the line being on leg stump Mathews is easily able to flick it away to long leg
stays on leg stump again and Mathews works it away to deep square leg
good length ball, slower through the air, on off stump. Cut away to deep point
that's the fifty partnership. Good, solid work from these two
shortish and sliding across the right-hander, Chandimal stays back and cuts to deep point
goes back to a good length ball on off stump and tucks it to midwicket

heaved away over midwicket! He's been vicious with the sweep, and judicious in its use. Always has a powerful go at it. Ensures he lunge as far forward as he could. And this time he had the breeze helping him as well
tossed up and drifting in on leg stump, Chandimal nurdles it to midwicket for an easy single
tossed up on middle and leg, turned away into the midwicket region
stays back to a good length ball on off stump, punched back at the bowler

outside edge, but they've done away with the slip! Mathews was looking midwicket again and closed the bat too early. Yasir pulls out some turn off the deck and has to watch the outside edge skip away to the third man boundary
some turn, which fetches the inside edge of Chandimal. Again Hafeez is pin-point with his length. Slows it up and tosses it up. But ensures he does not let the batsman get under him
beautiful little deflection! Heaps of flight from Hafeez, but the line slides down. Mathews is well aware of it and concentrates on placing this glance fine enough to beat long leg. Fantastic cricket
gets forward to a tossed up delivery on off stump, and outside the line of it as well, while blocking
nudged away through midwicket. That's why he's planting his front leg outside off, to open up the leg side
good length ball worked past the short midwicket fielder's right
lovely bowling. Holds this one back as he hits a good length well outside off stump. Mathews can't work it to leg from there
skids on with the arm and Chandimal likes the extra pace on it. Whips it away to deep square leg
tossed up just outside off, Mathews pushes it into the gap at cover and sets off. Good running, good cricket from this pair
pulled into playing a touch away from the body as he guides a good length ball behind point
pushed through on off stump, it straightens just enough to fool Chandimal. He was playing with a closed face and gets a leading edge
tossed up and sliding in on middle, Chandimal drives to deep cover
strong drive to long-off. He gets the width that allows him the freedom to power it away down the ground
back of a length on off stump, glided behind point
looks for third man again, but Rahat has not offered one bit of room to merit such a stroke. So the inside edge drifts away to long leg. Precise bowling again

races down the track, and he was there. He had turned a length delivery into an overpitched one. The only problem was he had given himself a touch more room. Swish and miss, because he was looking for midwicket instead of straight down the ground

oh dear! That's a slower short ball, well wide of leg stump. All Chandimal had to do was get some bat on it. Does so with a controlled little pull. Irfan is down there, looks to try and kick the ball away before it reaches the boundary. Poor effort from the big man
shortish and outside off, dabbed to deep third man
another offcutter outside off, Mathews extends his hands and guides it to point
luck that he didn't put that away. Chandimal rocked back to a short ball and had he got the gap between point and short third man as he intended, that might have been four
tossed up outside off, Chandimal looks for the big slog sweep again. But got a little too close to the ball. Struck outside the line so no point in the lbw appeal
good length ball a shade outside off, Chandimal looks for the sweep again and is struck on the pads outside off again
tossed up and drifting in on middle and leg, Chandimal tucks it through to deep midwicket

is that a top edge? Yep. Looks for the big hit against the turn and is beaten in the flight. Mathews can't quite get as close to the ball as he wanted to with the slog sweep. That means the ball is able to spin just enough that he has to drag it away from outside off into the leg side. Azam at long-on is safe as houses
flighted just outside off, Chandimal blocks into the covers to retain strike
tossed up just outside off, Chandimal finds short midwicket
down the track with a push to long-on
tossed up just outside off, Thisara drive to long-off
loads of turn into the batsman as he backs away. Chandimal, credit to him, only guides it behind point. Didn't look to hit it too hard at all
nearly popped back to the bowler! Another left-hander is put under pressure by Hafeez's drift in. Thisara goes for a flick, gets a leading edge and it falls inches short of Hafeez

ends his spell with a wicket. And that's his best figures in ODIs. Might need to get a gift for Rizwan for this. Beautiful low catch by him at first slip. Especially seeing as the batsman was backing away for a cut. So even if it was an edge, it would have come to him quite quickly. Nice, tight bowling from Hafeez. Good length on middle from around the wicket. Thisara was looking to slice it to third man and get off strike. But the ball went a bit too fine
back of a length and outside off, eased to point
leaps up to get on top of the bounce to slap it away to deep point
banged in short, Milinda gets under it safely
shortish on off stump, Milinda blocks. Not the easiest bowler to face for your first ball in ODIs
shortish and just outside off, sliced away to point
banged in short, Chandimal swivels on the back foot and pulls strongly to deep square leg. Great placement, he'll need a few of those going his way. Ensured he kept it down as well
good length ball on and around off stump, defended
clipped away to deep midwicket. That time there was no spin for Malik, because he was concentrating on pushing the ball through
good length ball, with a bit more air. So it does turn. The problem though is it was way down leg
another one that meanders down leg again. Chandimal on 49 would have lovede a little tickle there to fine leg
a tap to the right of short third man and that brings up an important fifty from a good young batsman. Provided he gives himself a chance. Chandimal needs to bat through
nips down the track for a good length ball and blocks
wanders down the track again and whips it to deep midwicket
drifting away outside off, Chandimal jumps back and cuts to deep point
waits on a shortish delivery and lets it glide off the open face to deep third man
he's having a little trouble getting the ball past the infield. This was short and outside off, but he's cracked it straight to point
that's the big dipper! The ball starts at a height of 10 feet and then is speared in at the base of middle stump. Just about kept out
that's in the slot and Milinda has pasted it over mid-off. Good strike under pressure from the debutant. Cleared that front leg and swung through the line
predictable change in length. Clipped the shorter one into the gap at midwicket and they pick up a couple by the time mid-on catches up with it

full toss on off stump, punched back down the pitch. And hey, there might be a run out here. Irfan uses his height to his advantage again as he sticks one of those windmill like hands out and hurls a throw back at the batsman's stumps. The meandering Milinda though has got back just in time
good length on leg stump, Chandimal nudges it through square leg for a single
ooh! The loopy leading edge hangs in the air, but not long enough for the bowler to get across. Again, the batsman closing the face too early when the ball stops on the pitch
that's short and he's short-arm pulled it away to deep midwicket
eases down the track to a good length ball on middle. The gap at midwicket is inviting again, but he doesn't connect. Ball balloons off his pads to point

that's so desperately unfortunate for Rizwan! He has almost pulled off a catch and a half. Running full tilt to his right, diving full length, he was horizontal with the ground when the ball sticks in his right hand. Untili then, all is well. All is spectacular. He tracked Milinda's front foot slice so well at long-off. But the ball pops out of his hand as he lands and both he and it trickle to the boundary. Should have been one for the highlight reels, it might still be but Rizwan will watch it with a wry smile
shortish on middle and leg, pulled to long leg
moves around the wicket for a back of a length delivery on off stump, swung away to long-on
banged in short to the debutant, who ducks under it

that time he goes for it and finds a six over backward point, I think. Top strike, rode the bounce that Irfan gets and slashes it away. Didn't have any intention to keep the ball down and placed it well to the right of deep point
almost a yorker just outside off, Milinda drills it to long-off and Rizwan keeps that to just a single. He's a wicketkeeper by trade, but he moves excellently in the outfield as well
wanders across outside off, is met by a low full toss, Chandimal sweeps it behind square leg.

oopsy, that's a top edge! It is swirling at deep square leg. Would need a spectacular effort to get this. Shehzad isn't quite able to pull it off. Rushes in, then realises the wind had diverted the ball to his left, Shehzad dives forward. But he doesn't even get his fingers to it

Rizwan, you little beauty! He is so good to watch in the field. Kisses the ball before tossing it away. Another skier, but this time the fielder has less distance to cover. I think he was in the covers, raced in and called for it. Anyway the only other man who could have caught it was Rahat, who you don't want under a tough catch. Rizwan has his eyes all the way on it, dives and holds on this time
banged in short, Chandimal pulls it to deep square leg
ah, he's slapped it away to extra cover. Simple dismissal. Enough room for him to swat it away, as he was trying to do. But the placement eludes him
nice and full on middle, Lasith is caught in the crease as he blocks
shot! Looks for the yorker, ends up with a full toss outside off. Chandimal walks across and scoops it well to the left of short fine leg
walks across outside off, Anwar nails the yorker better this time. Squirted out to midwcket. Single taken, and a touch of gloves between Malinga and Chandimal
almost a yorker just outside off, but Malinga does well. Pushes it into the off side and returns the strike to the better batsman
looks for the sweep again, but Anwar's yorkers have gotten better accuracy. Hit him on the boot and has to settle for a leg bye
nice and full on off stump, Malinga bunts it down the ground and is being pushed to take two. Good work from Sri Lanka. No reason to hoard strike with only one ball left

length ball outside off, Malinga slashes it to extra cover and secures a single. The throw came in quickly enough, the bowler was beside the stumps as well. But Anwar doesn't have a hold on the ball as he breaks the stumps. Malinga was miles out of his crease, of course

inn2.comm: spears in an awayswinging yorker, Azhar is perhaps slightly surprised by the option but is able enough to answer with a straight bat
another fuller delivery on off stump, eased down the pitch and back to the bowler
good length ball just outside off, Azhar punches it into the covers. Prasanna, moving to his right from point, lets it through. Maybe that was a touch harsh, he got a bit of a bad bounce
back of a length and outside off, Shehzad watches it pass harmlessly through to the keeper

excellent push past mid-off. That shot hasn't been the easiest on this pitch - leaning forward, driving on the up and hitting through the line. But the extra pace Malinga brings helps the batsman out.
fullish on middle, Azhar moves around it to the off side and clips it through midwicket
fuller delivery on off stump, with a touch of curl away. Shehzad adjusts to it and pushes to mid-off
appreciable seam away from the bat as he squares Shehzad up. But his decision to play straight aids him
shortish on middle and leg, Shehzad skips inside the line and clips it away to midwicket
fuller delivery outside off, driven to mid-off

inside edge to ruin the leg-before appeal. Nice and full from Lakmal, he's in better rhythm than at the Pallekele Test. Angles the ball in and Shehzad is sucked in by it. Looks to play around his front pad towards midwicket and would have been out had he not got wood on it
back of a length and outside off, shoulders arms

began with the yorker in the last over, this time it's the slower ball. Azhar moves inside the line again and clips it neatly to deep square leg. And the connection is absolutely stunning. Might have helped that he hit it with the breeze
back of a length and outside off, punched into the covers

top edge! But it lobs square leg and doesn't carry as far as long leg. The short ball comes at Azhar a touch too early as he went for the pull. Not the full blooded one, more like a guide behind square
fuller delivery outside off, driven into the covers

that was asking to be hit and Shehzad says thank you very much. That time the short ball barely has the bounce it needs to be a threat. The batsman rocks back and pulls miles in front of midwicket, off almost the front foot
shortish and outside off, glided down to third man
excellent accuracy from Lakmal. Bowls full, gets a little nibble away and on middle stump it's threatening to the batsman. Shehzad drives carefully to mid-on

smashing drive thorugh the covers! His weight is always on the front foot, and he does look so good when he connects the drive. Width from Lakmal, Shehzad's placed it to the left of the fielder and his timing is top class
shortish and outside off, crunched to the 39-year old Dilshan at point
back of a length on off stump, Shehzad is pushed back and blocks. The extra bounce that this pitch has offered puts Shehzhad in a little tangle
shortish on middle and off, Shehzad gets inside the line and clips to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Shehzad pings mid-off
starts off nicely. Just back of a length and outside off, Azhar shoulders arms

ooh, squared up and the bat leading quite a way in front of the body. Nice, fuller delivery on off stump to suck the batsman into a false stroke. Seems like he was looking to slap it through the off side, and then decides to check his stroke

good length ball on middle, Azhar clips it away to the midwicket boundary. Not particularly well timed, but mid-on isn't all that interested. Malinga appears quite content to fetch it back from the boundary
some extra bounce, which forces Azhar to jump off his feet to block it down the pitch
shortish and outside off, punched to point
another slash towards point, but Dilshan's as good as anyone there

shortish on middle and off, Shehzad is put in an awkward position because of the nip back into him and a little more bounce than he expected. To his credit though, he plays with soft hands and nudges it to midwicket for an excellent single
shortish and outside off, Azhar looks for the slice to third man but is beaten for pace and bounce. Both a little too much for his liking

he's not having the best time in the field. Malinga at long leg goes for a slide but the ball bounces off his hand and into the boundary. A little too straight from Lakmal and was righly glanced away, but Sri Lanka really should be doing better in the field
back of a length and just outside off, blocked solidly
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
back of a length and outside off, knocked into the covers
very crisply hit, but this time Prasanna is able to haul the ball back at the cover boundary. Punched through the covers, and he's managed to hit the gap too
sliced away into the off side and the opportunity for the quick single is converted
shortish and outside off, run down to point
not particularly short, but he's confident against the medium pacer. Camps back and swipes across the line to midwicket. Off more of an under-edge

that time he dug it in a little more and it zips off the pitch. Shehzad wears a smile as he expresses the same to his partner. Goes for the cut, the shot was on as well with a lot of room outside off, but he's beaten
that time he's nailed it. No trouble with the bounce there as he stays back, watches the ball all the way onto his bat and slaps it behind point
walks down at the medium pacer, who drifts his line well outside off. Azhar eventually has to leave it
shortish and outside off, sliced away to deep third man
down the track to a good length ball, and he was looking to thread it away through cover again. Only manages an inside edge to long leg

great work from Dilshan at point. Leaps to his right to save a certain boundary. Azhar was looking to simply glide the shortish ball outside off stump - no intention to overhit it - but the fielder was awake to the challenge
so Azhar takes Dilshan out of the equation. Sways away to have enough room to cut the ball behind him

another inside edge, but it dribbles away too fine. Full and outside off enough to suck Shehzad into an airy drive. Hitting through the line like that hasn't been easy on this slightly two-paced pitch. And that time it is slower than the batsman expects
Malinga's the culprit again. The ball's following him and he doesn't like it. Easy single to mid-on. Azhar's looking quite smart on the drive
shortish and just outside off, Shehzad blocks it carefully
gets up off his toes to manage the bounce off this shortish delivery outside off. Then all he had to do is plant the open face down on it to find the single to deep third man
full on off stump, skewed to mid-off as Azhar realises he shouldn't close the bat face. Late adjustment serves him well enough
goes quite short, but he doesn't have the bounce to trouble the batsman. Azhar merely has to shift back in his crease and pull. Finds square leg though
walks at the bowler, who shifts his line outside off. Azhar dabs behind point
good length ball on off stump, defended. Keeper's come up to stop Azhar leaping outside his crease

done him in! Chandimal and Mathews combine to bring Sri Lanka back again. It was wide, it was tempting Azhar to go for the booming drive through cover. In all honesty, the shot was on. But on a pitch where the bounce isn't true, there's always a risk involved with driving on the up. Azhar gets an under edge and Chandimal takes an absolute stunner. Stayed low, moved to his right along with the ball and snapped it up
fuller delivery outside off, Hafeez lets it go
a little nibble away for Mathews who keeps the ball well wide of off stump and not there for the drive. Slip lies in wait
blocks a back of a lenght delivery on and around off stump. Hafeez had shimmied down to try and make the pace there. Couldn't

oh, that's slapped away through cover. Only a shade short and not even that wide. But medium pacers have very little room for error. Even against new batsman. Hafeez crunches it away off the back foot
good length ball on off stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with

extra bounce! Shezhad was looking to dab it behind point, but that little juice in this track makes that shot dicey. The batsman, to his credit, softens the grip on his bat and lets it run down the open face to third man. Didn't commit to his premeditation. Adjusted very nicely there
back of a length delivery on off stump, has Hafeez squared up as he blocks
oh, had him squared up again. He was looking to play the angle of a good length ball on off stump, looking for midwicket. But then has to realise he needs to play straighter
dug in a little shorter and it seams away into the keeper's gloves. Hafeez's doesn't take the bait

skews off the outside edge as Shehzad drives away from the body. That front foot didn't get across enough towards this fuller ball nibbling away. And his hands were making up for that. So the outisde edge comes and wanders to deep third man
walks out at the medium pacer, who throws down an angry short ball. Hafeez pulls to deep midwicket
banged in short again, and it gains enough height for Shehzad to duck under
fuller deliver probing away just outside off, Shehzad lets it pass him
back of a length and outside off, he tries to whip it from there to the leg side. The ball ends up at cover
short and wide, slapped to point where Dilshan leaps up to his full height and pulls it down
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with

indipper! Inside edge! Run out chance! Jerked back at it from the pitch as Hafeez was looking for a back foot punch. Should only have been a single, but they decide on a second late. The throw that comes in is poor though. Got the right end - the bowler's - but it went down the middle of the pitch almost
back of a length and outside off. punched through the covers
dug in short, but Hafeez is comfortable with the pull. Nails it to long leg

loads more bounce than should have been and the batsman did well not to get sucked into his stroke. He was again looking for the dab to third man, but seeing the alarming lift, he decides to pull away and just in time
good length ball just outside off, Shehzad appears worried by the bounce off the last ball and blocks gingerly
cramps him for room and that's great work after the batsman races down the track. A little nip into the batsman has him in a tangle. Manages an inside edge onto the thighs and into the off side
oh, a touch too full and a touch too wide that time. Lifted over extra cover. Stand and deliver stuff from Hafeez. Not the wisest shot on this pitch, but that time he's nailed it
good length ball just outside off, defended
leans in and opens the face to a good length ball outside off and gets it down to third man
shortish and outside off, sliced it down to deep third man again
good length on off stump, defended into the covers. Can't do much more with the bal in that area

he's fished outside off and has been caught! Sri Lanka created the pressure. They stopped the singles. They got a few balls to bounce alarmingly. Shehzad weathered through all of them and will be filthy with himself at being sucked into playing so far away from his body. Didn't move across, flashed at it and feathers a simple edge to the keeper
banged in short on middle and leg, ducks under it
shortish and outside off, pokes away from the body and misses
offcutter pushed full and outside off, driven to long-on
drives a little lazily, but he's managed to place it behind point. They're not getting across when they're driving outside off. Outside edge to third man

serene hit over point. He's watched a few of his partners and their sloppy footwork and shows them all up by moving confidently towards the wider delivery outside off. Nicely balanced, he drives through the line
appeal for leg before as the batsman moves across in front of his stumps. But Mathews had moved wide of the crease and this would have slipped down leg
back of a length and outside off, Hafeez jumps out of the crease and leave
into the forward defensive too early as Mathews beats him with a slower ball that cuts back into him. There's that extra bounce on offer again as he is struck under the stomach
fuller delivery outside off, slid to point

stands up nicely behind the shortish delivery outside off and crunches it through point. He's getting into better positions before hitting at balls outside off. A little query about the run out as Chandimal moves in front of the stumps to collect, but he deflects the ball back at the stumps. The batsman was well in though
walks down the pitch and pushes his bat at a fuller delivery outside off. Edge wanders away to deep third man. That'd be drinks
angles the ball in on middle and leg, Hafeez plays it late and nudges to the right of mid-on
shortish and outside off, Azam slices it to point
punched through the gap at cover, who has been pushed back into the deep. A shade shorter than he needs to be is Lakmal there
offcutter on middle, seemed to stick in the pitch a little longer as well. Hafeez adjusts, waits that tad longer and plays with a straight bat for a single to mid-on
slower short ball, Azam keeps to his crease and pulls well in front of square. Picked the length early, saw the gap at midwicket and exploited it
fullish and just outside off, Azhar punches it down the ground quite well. Lakmal manages to save a few good runs moving to his right on his followthrough
good length ball outside off, shoulders arms
that had a bit more behind it. Beautiful length and line that doesn't allow the batsman to drive or cut. Left alone and it gets a lot of bounce
fuller delivery outside off, not bothered with

inside edge, but it fall short of the keeper, who actually does well to dive to his right and stop it  from skipping away. Looks like this is a good move from Sri Lanka. Malinga's unsettled Hafeez a bit here, plays a cut and is surprised by the bounce keeping low this time
nice and tight on off stump, with a little more bounce as well. Hafeez is wary of it as he blocks
width on offer, pressure released. Throws his bat at it and finds a boundary over cover
pushed through on middle and leg, Azam goes back and clips to midwicket
tossed up outside off, Azam drives down the ground but Prasanna flings himself to his left and saves some runs. he's magnificent off his own bowling
gets down the track and drills a length ball down towards long-on. Or it would have gone there had it not deflected off Hafeez's bat
down the track to drive at a silly mid-off position. Looks like he's there for the leading edge
there it is! But he had closed the face early - sucked in by the drift in - then it turns away sharply and there is no one at short cover
gets down the track and drives a flighted delivery to cover
shortish and outside off, punched to cover
looks for the fuller length on off stump, but Azam's controlled it well. Goes for the whip to deep square leg
good length ball just outside off, nudged off the inside edge behind square leg. But forget all that, this is great running from Pakistan to snitch a couple

belated appeal from the keeper, possibly after seeing Malinga going for it. It was a shortish delivery just outside off. Hafeez goes for a cut, not quite enough width for the shot. Plus there's that unhelpful extra bounce. Beaten all ends up
good work from Hafeez though. Stays back to a shorter ball, plays it quite late and clips a single to mid-on
banged in quite short and it soars over the crouching batsman
shortish and outside off, Azam moves inside the line and pulls wide of mid-on
oooh, turn for Seekkuge. Looped it in at the batsman to draw him into playing then the ball veers away quite sharply to beat him
reaches the pitch this time and drives back at the bowler
flighted outside off and he drives sweetly to deep cover
leans forward to a flighted delivery outside off to find mid-off
skips down the track and gets a little too close, hacks it away to long-on
drops it short and Azam has slapped it away to deep point. Excellent footwork there, using the depth of the crease and finding the gap behind point
falls short of the onrushing fielder at mid-on. A few yards slower that time, and the fuller ball was floated outside off. Into the drive too early, and manages to survive
shortish and outside off, clipped away wide of mid-on
shortish on middle and leg, whipped away to deep midwicket
down the track, meets a short ball head on and pulls it away to deep square leg
good length just outside off, Azam checks his front foot press and guides it to point
manages a little cut back in and Azam just about gets an inside edge
tossed up outside off, driven through the covers
tossed up just outside off, driven to long-on
dances down the track and drives to short cover

long-on has decided to stay back because it was Malinga, and he wouldn't have been able to run forward quick enough to convert the opportunity. Hafeez showing signs off pressure as he runs at the bowler and lifts him
quick delivery, sliding in on off stump. Sliced to point
running down the track and heaves it away to deep midwicket. They're just about staying ahead of the game right now and these hits are definitely helping
looped up just outside off, eased through the covers
that's short and Azam's stayed back to cut strongly. Protection in the deep though
tossed up outside off, driven to the sweeper again

big appeal for leg before. It appeared very close too. Looks like they'lo go up for the review? Nope. It was nicely tossed up outside off, Hafeez goes for the big sweep, but it seems he has got the front pad outside the line of the off stump
skips down the pitch to block a good length ball on off stump

lobs short midwicket! A streaky way to raise the fifty stand, but it's kept Pakistan ticking along nicely. Since Malinga's introduction, Hafeez has looked a little jittery. This time he was running down the track, beaten by the dip Dilshan gets and gets a thick inside edge. Midwicket leaps up as high as he can, but it's not enough
drilled down the ground to long-on because Prasanna is spearing them in
tossed up on middle and off, leans forward to block
opens the face and slices a flighted delivery to point
shortish and outside off, cut away and beats the lone fielder in the deep at point. Strong shot from Hafeez, and it's one of his more composed ones
short and pushed into the batsman, Hafeez pulls it away to deep midwicket. Didn't hit it all that well, which may have helped him
nicely flighted outside off, smeared away to deep cover

caught in front! Azam was walking off, but he is called back by his partner. Has a little chat with Hafeez and then makes the decision himself that he doesn't want to review. Azam goes for the sweep, but hasn't put that front leg too far across. Misses the ball hitting across the line and is struck in line with off stump, I think

loads of excitement! Another leg before appeal! But this is given as runs! It was shorter, and it zips in off the pitch as well. Struck in line with off stump, and he was jumping back in his crease too so there was no doubt about height. The only saving grace though was Malik managed an inside edge
tossed up outside off, nudged through square leg
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off  for a single
flighted in on off stump, Hafeez presses forward to block
flighted on off stump, driven back at the bowler
reaches the pitch and hammers the ball straight down the ground. That's his fifty. Sized up the flight, turned an good length ball into an overpitched delivery and launches it
slower delivery on off stump, driven to extra cover
that's skewed off the outside half of the batm with long-off and deep cover tracking its progress. But to his luck, he hit it into the wind and that stops the ball from carrying
leans into a drive, and this time it's all along the ground
looks to nudge a good lengthh ball off the thigh pads, can't get bat to it
fuller delivery on middle and off, keeps quite low that time. Hafeez keeps it out well
skips down the track and drives calmly to cover
advances on the bowler again and hits it down the ground to long-on
presses forward to block a flighted delivery outside off
preempts the batsman jumping down the track as he pulls his length back and fires it in at the pads. Malik has to block
good length ball on middle, defended
looped in on off stump, driven to short cover
tonked over long-off. He's playing Prasanna so well. Spots the flight early, eases down the pitch, makes sure he has all the room he needs to useful his arms through the ball
and again. This time a slogsweep over midwicket. Length ball from the leggie has been smote away
flighted in on middle, drilled to long-off
tossed up in to leg stump, nudged to long-on
goes back to a good length ball and punches it to long-on
strays a bit too straight and Hafeez picks him away behind square leg
pushed through on middle and leg, nudged to mid-on
tossed up on middle, deftly placed down to long-on
looked to one-up the batsman who was charging him by firing it down the leg side. Hafeez manages to connect with the flick and secure a single. Jogs it with a smile, he knows how close he was
good length ball on middle, clipped to fine leg
tossed up on middle, driven to long-on
loads of flight, perhaps too much even. Hafeez digs it out to mid-off
fired in quickly on leg stump, this time. Hafeez swept it strongly to deep square leg.
puts it to the right of short third man. Excellent footwork against spin as he makes some to take the ball off middle and get a couple
goes back to clip and good length ball through midwicket
beautifully done! It was a shade short, and he tagged it with width as well. Hafeez gets down low and slices it well behind third man. Top shot
plays back to a loopy delivery outside off. Third man is too seductive for Malik. Poor shot, lucky not to nick it through to the keeper
down the track for a little nudge to short midwicket

fired in onto leg stump, Hafeez who was camping deep in his crease, pulls it away between long leg and deep square leg. He's toying with the spinners now, who are afraid of him charging down the track and so are bowling quick
fuller delivery, this time Hafeez does advance and he drives to cover
clipped away behind square leg from deep in the crease
full on off stump, pushed to mid-off
full toss, punished. That's the fifty stand and Malik has contributed only 10 to it. Hafeez is on a serious roll here. Looking for the yorker, but it's been whipped away through midwicket
fuller delivery, looks to flick it away. Too far down leg
slower ball on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
finds the yorker on middle, Malik is more than a match for it
goes for the short ball, Malik gets inside the line and deflects it away to long leg
another full toss on middle that's been picked away on the leg side
a little drift outside off, Hafeez is careful with it. Waits as much as he can and then slices it to cover
down the track to drive the flighted ball through to cover
sliding in on middle and he sweeps it along the ground to long leg
leans forward and drills a fuller, wider deliver to long-off
another little skip down the track, and though he isn't quite to the pitch, he's so well settled that he can let his hands flow through the ball. Excellent play against spin bowling
gets forward and nudges a full delivery through to midwicket. That's drinks
shortish and wandering away down leg. Malik attempts a flick, but can't connect
another short ball, which slips down the leg side. Malik this time shoulders arms and collects the second successive extra
gets up off his toes to blunt another short ball, this one just outside off stump
another bouncer, but this might be a touch too high? Nope, the umpires are a little sympathetic to his little burst from Malinga. Batsman's ducked under it of course

dabs it by his feet and Hafeez has pulled his partner across for a quick single. Excellent work, from the batman for pulling his bottom hand off and ensuring the ball doesn't travel too far. And then by the non-striker for sensiing the opportunity
fuller delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off
squeezes a pretty full delivery through point as he opens the face and picks the gap to the left of cover. Beautiful batting from Hafeez. He's only one away from a well deserved century
full and sliding down leg, no need to put bat to that. Although Hafeez tries hard with a flick
drops a good length delivery into the off side and immediately sets off. Malik though is aware enough to yell no and send his partner back before he gets run out on 99
fuller delivery outside off, punched to short cover. Half a stop means Pakistan can pinch a single
back of a length on off stump, defended
lifted over point and away to the boundary. His 10th ODI hundred, and the last four (including this) are against Sri Lanka. Enough room outside off for him to pounce on
shortish and outside off, run away down behind third man

pops up a return catch! Jumps down the track for no good reason, Thisara bowls it short and quick on middle. Cramps the batsman up. Goes for a panicked pull, gets it on the splice and gives a simple catch to Thisara. But he's done his work. Gets a hug from his captain, a pat on the back from his coach. Good innings

shake of the head from the umpire. Did he nick it? Mathews is of the belief it had hit him high. I'm not entirely sure. It's one of those skidders that hits the pitch and jags back at the new batsman. As if the pitch wants to tell everyone that it's still there. Did hit the top flap of the pad, but he was quite a way back in his crease
good length ball that is angled in on leg stump and turns away nicely. Rizwan watches it all the way onto his dead bat
short and outside off, slapped away through the covers
tossed up outside off, Rizwan smears it away through the covers with hard hands.
nimble footwork gets him to the pitch, and he's also made some room to slap it away over long-off. Excellent shot to put the pressure back on the bowler
they're targeting the leggie no matter the situation. Jumps back into his crease to one that is only slightly short, drags it from way outside off and creams it to the midwicket boundary
good length ball on middle, clipped through square leg
dug in short, Malik doesn't want anything to do with it outside off
shortish and outside off, Malik was looking to work it away on leg and gets a bit of a leading edge down the pitch
back of a length ball on off stump, defended into the off side for another quick single
full on off stump, whipped to mid-on
pushes him back with a shortish delivery outside off, punched through the covers
full and swirling in on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
another yorker that was moving in on off stump, Rizwan keeps it out though
that's the slower yorker, Rizwan was caught unawares. He had got into a flick too early, and then has to slow his hands down. Somehow he manages to make good enough contact that it beats mid-on
another excellent yorker on middle and off, clipped to mid-on
goes short this time and Rizwan has pulled it strongly to deep square leg.
good length ball outside off, dabbed to point
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
down the track, but it's a bit too full for him to get under. Punched to long-off
good length ball on off stump, defended
that's a low full toss on leg stump, driven to long-off
pushed through on leg stump, nudged to midwicket
some flight there, Malik races forward to it and heaves it over mid-on. Didn't connect very well, but it had enough to lob the fielder
jumps up off his feet to manage a short delivery on off stump
that's a top delivery. Bangs it in short and beats the batsman for pace. Don't be fooled by the gun saying 129 kph. It rose up to around the batsman's left ear as he was looking to hook it
that time he connects with the short ball, rolls his wrists having got on top of the bounce. Lovely hook shot. Beats Thisara on the long leg boundary even though he had about three steps to move
full and slow outside off, pushed through to deep third man
sweet drive to mid-off as Malik steps forward to a fuller ball outside off

launched over mid-on. Saw the opportunity to get under one of Malinga's fuller deliveries - doesn't happen too often - and then takes full toll. This is a gamely burst from the fast bowler, but he's noticeably down on fitness and that inevitable loose ball ends up coming out
tossed up outside off, swept fine to long leg
pushed through on middle and off, punched to long-on
stays back to push a good length ball back to Dilshan
skips down the track to block a flighted delivery outside off
a shade short and he pulls it to long leg powerfully
moves back to a fuller ball, but he's able to place it neatly in the gap in front of point
he has not been accurate at all, and that continues. Slides a short delivery down leg, doesn't turn either. Clipped past short fine leg with the littlest fuss
full toss now on middle, swept strongly to deep square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
down the track, gets too close to the pitch and drills it through cover
flighted on middle, and gets the ball to dip well. Malik goes for a slog and gets an inside edge to deep square leg
worked away towards midwicket as Prasanna's radar goes wonky again. Too far down leg
dances down the track and heaves it away over cover. Didn't connect well at all. Looks for the glory shot, but he doesn't get close enough to the pitch
punched to long-on, this was short and it was the legspiner as well
nudged away off the thigh pad to long leg
good length ball on off stump, defended
swept away as Dilshan inches too close to leg stump
that looked like the seam up delivery. Malik moves away and slices it to deep point
tossed up on off stump, eased down to long-on
flighted just outside off, defended to short cover
good length ball outside off, defended to point
presses forward to block.
solid forward defensive again
another simple block into the covers to end the over
flighted just outside off, driven to cover

smashed away! That's the win. That's his fifty. That's a 1-0 lead in this five-match series. Tucks his bat under his arm as soon as he made contact after dancing down the track. So another pristine chase from Pakistan. Did you expect anything less after Pallekele?
